controls.name: Understanding the organisation and its context
controls.description: The organisation shall determine external and internal issues that are relevant to its purpose and that affect its ability to achieve the intended outcome(s) of its information security management system.

controls.name: Understanding the needs and expectations of interested parties
controls.description: The organisation shall determine interested parties that are relevant to the ISMS and their requirements relevant to information security.

controls.name: Determining the scope of the ISMS
controls.description: The organisation shall determine the boundaries and applicability of the ISMS to establish its scope, considering external/internal issues and requirements.

controls.name: Information security management system
controls.description: The organisation shall establish, implement, maintain and continually improve an ISMS in accordance with the requirements of ISO 27001.

controls.name: Leadership and commitment
controls.description: Top management shall demonstrate leadership and commitment with respect to the ISMS by ensuring policy objectives are established and compatible with strategic direction.

controls.name: Policy
controls.description: Top management shall establish an information security policy that is appropriate to the purpose of the organisation and provides a framework for setting objectives.

controls.name: Organisational roles, responsibilities and authorities
controls.description: Top management shall ensure that responsibilities and authorities for roles relevant to information security are assigned and communicated.

controls.name: Actions to address risks and opportunities
controls.description: When planning for the ISMS, the organisation shall consider issues and requirements and determine risks and opportunities that need to be addressed.

controls.name: Information security objectives and planning
controls.description: The organisation shall establish information security objectives at relevant functions and levels, which are consistent with the policy and measurable.

controls.name: Planning of changes
controls.description: When the organisation determines the need for changes to the ISMS, the changes shall be carried out in a planned manner.

controls.name: Resources
controls.description: The organisation shall determine and provide the resources needed for the establishment, implementation, maintenance and continual improvement of the ISMS.

controls.name: Competence
controls.description: The organisation shall determine necessary competence of persons doing work under its control that affects information security performance.

controls.name: Awareness
controls.description: Persons doing work under the organisation's control shall be aware of the information security policy, their contribution to ISMS effectiveness, and implications of not conforming.

controls.name: Communication
controls.description: The organisation shall determine the need for internal and external communications relevant to the ISMS including what, when, with whom, and how to communicate.

controls.name: Documented information
controls.description: The organisation's ISMS shall include documented information required by ISO 27001 and determined by the organisation as necessary for ISMS effectiveness.

controls.name: Operational planning and control
controls.description: The organisation shall plan, implement and control the processes needed to meet information security requirements and implement the actions determined in clause 6.

controls.name: Information security risk assessment
controls.description: The organisation shall perform information security risk assessments at planned intervals or when significant changes are proposed or occur.

controls.name: Information security risk treatment
controls.description: The organisation shall implement the information security risk treatment plan and retain documented information of the results of the risk treatment.

controls.name: Monitoring, measurement, analysis and evaluation
controls.description: The organisation shall determine what needs to be monitored and measured, including information security processes and controls.

controls.name: Internal audit
controls.description: The organisation shall conduct internal audits at planned intervals to provide information on whether the ISMS conforms to requirements and is effectively implemented.

controls.name: Management review
controls.description: Top management shall review the organisation's ISMS at planned intervals to ensure its continuing suitability, adequacy and effectiveness.

controls.name: Continual improvement
controls.description: The organisation shall continually improve the suitability, adequacy and effectiveness of the information security management system.

controls.name: Nonconformity and corrective action
controls.description: When a nonconformity occurs, the organisation shall react to it, evaluate the need for action, implement any action needed, review effectiveness, and make changes to the ISMS if necessary.

controls.name: Policies for information security
controls.description: Information security policy and topic-specific policies shall be defined, approved by management, published, communicated to and acknowledged by relevant personnel and relevant interested parties, and reviewed at planned intervals and if significant changes occur.

controls.name: Information security roles and responsibilities
controls.description: Information security roles and responsibilities shall be defined and allocated according to the organisation needs.

controls.name: Segregation of duties
controls.description: Conflicting duties and conflicting areas of responsibility shall be segregated.

controls.name: Management responsibilities
controls.description: Management shall require all personnel to apply information security in accordance with the established information security policy, topic-specific policies and procedures of the organisation.

controls.name: Contact with authorities
controls.description: The organisation shall establish and maintain contact with relevant authorities.

controls.name: Contact with special interest groups
controls.description: The organisation shall establish and maintain contact with special interest groups or other specialist security forums and professional associations.

controls.name: Threat intelligence
controls.description: Information relating to information security threats shall be collected and analysed to produce threat intelligence.

controls.name: Information security in project management
controls.description: Information security shall be integrated into project management.

controls.name: Inventory of information and other associated assets
controls.description: An inventory of information and other associated assets, including owners, shall be developed and maintained.

controls.name: Acceptable use of information and other associated assets
controls.description: Rules for the acceptable use and procedures for handling information and other associated assets shall be identified, documented and implemented.

controls.name: Return of assets
controls.description: Personnel and other interested parties as appropriate shall return all the organisation's assets in their possession upon change or termination of their employment, contract or agreement.

controls.name: Classification of information
controls.description: Information shall be classified according to the information security needs of the organisation based on confidentiality, integrity, availability and relevant interested party requirements.

controls.name: Labelling of information
controls.description: An appropriate set of procedures for information labelling shall be developed and implemented in accordance with the information classification scheme adopted by the organisation.

controls.name: Information transfer
controls.description: Information transfer rules, procedures, or agreements shall be in place for all types of transfer facilities within the organisation and between the organisation and other parties.

controls.name: Access control
controls.description: Rules to control physical and logical access to information and other associated assets shall be established and implemented based on business and information security requirements.

controls.name: Identity management
controls.description: The full life cycle of identities shall be managed.

controls.name: Authentication information
controls.description: Allocation and management of authentication information shall be controlled by a management process including advising personnel on appropriate handling of authentication information.

controls.name: Access rights
controls.description: Access rights to information and other associated assets shall be provisioned, reviewed, modified and removed in accordance with the organisation's topic-specific policy on and rules for access control.

controls.name: Information security in supplier relationships
controls.description: Processes and procedures shall be defined and implemented to manage the information security risks associated with the use of supplier's products or services.

controls.name: Addressing information security within supplier agreements
controls.description: Relevant information security requirements shall be established and agreed with each supplier based on the type of supplier relationship.

controls.name: Managing information security in the ICT supply chain
controls.description: Processes and procedures shall be defined and implemented to manage the information security risks associated with the ICT products and services supply chain.

controls.name: Monitoring, review and change management of supplier services
controls.description: The organisation shall regularly monitor, review, evaluate and manage change in supplier information security practices and service delivery.

controls.name: Information security for use of cloud services
controls.description: Processes for acquisition, use, management and exit from cloud services shall be established in accordance with the organisation's information security requirements.

controls.name: Information security incident management planning and preparation
controls.description: The organisation shall plan and prepare for managing information security incidents by defining, establishing and communicating information security incident management processes, roles and responsibilities.

controls.name: Assessment and decision on information security events
controls.description: The organisation shall assess information security events and decide if they are to be categorised as information security incidents.

controls.name: Response to information security incidents
controls.description: Information security incidents shall be responded to in accordance with the documented procedures.

controls.name: Learning from information security incidents
controls.description: Knowledge gained from information security incidents shall be used to strengthen and improve the information security controls.

controls.name: Collection of evidence
controls.description: The organisation shall establish and implement procedures for the identification, collection, acquisition and preservation of evidence related to information security events.

controls.name: Information security during disruption
controls.description: The organisation shall plan how to maintain information security at an appropriate level during disruption.

controls.name: ICT readiness for business continuity
controls.description: ICT readiness shall be planned, implemented, maintained and tested based on business continuity objectives and ICT continuity requirements.

controls.name: Legal, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements
controls.description: Legal, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements relevant to information security and the organisation's approach to meet these requirements shall be identified, documented and kept up to date.

controls.name: Intellectual property rights
controls.description: The organisation shall implement appropriate procedures to protect intellectual property rights.

controls.name: Protection of records
controls.description: Records shall be protected from loss, destruction, falsification, unauthorised access and unauthorised release.

controls.name: Privacy and protection of PII
controls.description: The organisation shall identify and meet the requirements regarding the preservation of privacy and protection of PII according to applicable laws and regulations and contractual requirements.

controls.name: Independent review of information security
controls.description: The organisation's approach to managing information security and its implementation including people, processes and technologies shall be reviewed independently at planned intervals, or when significant changes occur.

controls.name: Compliance with policies, rules and standards for information security
controls.description: Compliance with the organisation's information security policy, topic-specific policies, rules and standards shall be regularly reviewed.

controls.name: Documented operating procedures
controls.description: Operating procedures for information processing facilities shall be documented and made available to personnel who need them.

controls.name: Screening
controls.description: Background verification checks on all candidates to become personnel shall be carried out prior to joining the organisation and on an ongoing basis taking into consideration applicable laws, regulations and ethics and be proportional to the business requirements, the classification of the information to be accessed and the perceived risks.

controls.name: Terms and conditions of employment
controls.description: The employment contractual agreements shall state the personnel's and the organisation's responsibilities for information security.

controls.name: Information security awareness, education and training
controls.description: Personnel of the organisation and relevant interested parties shall receive appropriate information security awareness, education and training and regular updates of the organisation's information security policy, topic-specific policies and procedures, as relevant for their job function.

controls.name: Disciplinary process
controls.description: A disciplinary process shall be formalised and communicated to take actions against personnel and other relevant interested parties who have committed an information security policy violation.

controls.name: Responsibilities after termination or change of employment
controls.description: Information security responsibilities and duties that remain valid after termination or change of employment shall be defined, enforced and communicated to relevant personnel and other interested parties.

controls.name: Confidentiality or non-disclosure agreements
controls.description: Confidentiality or non-disclosure agreements reflecting the organisation's needs for the protection of information shall be identified, documented, regularly reviewed and signed by personnel and other relevant interested parties.

controls.name: Remote working
controls.description: Security measures shall be implemented when personnel are working remotely to protect information accessed, processed or stored outside the organisation's premises.

controls.name: Information security event reporting
controls.description: The organisation shall provide a mechanism for personnel to report observed or suspected information security events through appropriate channels in a timely manner.

controls.name: Physical security perimeters
controls.description: Security perimeters shall be defined and used to protect areas that contain information and other associated assets.

controls.name: Physical entry
controls.description: Secure areas shall be protected by appropriate entry controls and access points.

controls.name: Securing offices, rooms and facilities
controls.description: Physical security for offices, rooms and facilities shall be designed and implemented.

controls.name: Physical security monitoring
controls.description: Premises shall be continuously monitored for unauthorised physical access.

controls.name: Protecting against physical and environmental threats
controls.description: Protection against physical and environmental threats, such as natural disasters and other intentional or unintentional physical threats to infrastructure shall be designed and implemented.

controls.name: Working in secure areas
controls.description: Security measures for working in secure areas shall be designed and implemented.

controls.name: Clear desk and clear screen
controls.description: Clear desk rules for papers and removable storage media and clear screen rules for information processing facilities shall be defined and appropriately enforced.

controls.name: Equipment siting and protection
controls.description: Equipment shall be sited securely and protected.

controls.name: Security of assets off-premises
controls.description: Off-site assets shall be protected.

controls.name: Storage media
controls.description: Storage media shall be managed through their life cycle of acquisition, use, transportation and disposal in accordance with the organisation's classification scheme and handling requirements.

controls.name: Supporting utilities
controls.description: Information processing facilities shall be protected from power failures and other disruptions caused by failures in supporting utilities.

controls.name: Cabling security
controls.description: Cables carrying power, data or supporting information services shall be protected from interception, interference or damage.

controls.name: Equipment maintenance
controls.description: Equipment shall be maintained correctly to ensure availability, integrity and confidentiality of information.

controls.name: Secure disposal or re-use of equipment
controls.description: Items of equipment containing storage media shall be verified to ensure that any sensitive data and licensed software has been removed or securely overwritten prior to disposal or re-use.

controls.name: User endpoint devices
controls.description: Information stored on, processed by or accessible via user endpoint devices shall be protected.

controls.name: Privileged access rights
controls.description: The allocation and use of privileged access rights shall be restricted and managed.

controls.name: Information access restriction
controls.description: Access to information and other associated assets shall be restricted in accordance with the established topic-specific policy on access control.

controls.name: Access to source code
controls.description: Read and write access to source code, development tools and software libraries shall be appropriately managed.

controls.name: Secure authentication
controls.description: Secure authentication technologies and procedures shall be implemented based on information access restrictions and the topic-specific policy on access control.

controls.name: Capacity management
controls.description: The use of resources shall be monitored and adjusted in line with current and expected capacity requirements.

controls.name: Protection against malware
controls.description: Protection against malware shall be implemented and supported by appropriate user awareness.

controls.name: Management of technical vulnerabilities
controls.description: Information about technical vulnerabilities of information systems in use shall be obtained, the organisation's exposure to such vulnerabilities shall be evaluated and appropriate measures shall be taken.
